title: I don't think Ahri deserves another skin yet

replies.body: Am i the only one that hates that Ezreal is getting a new skin as well, because him AND Ahri got an Arcade skin last year, and it's triggering me that they are both getting a Star Guardian skin, which is pretty damn close to Arcade.

Ezreal has received a new skin every year except one, since his release.
Ive just accepted that we shall have the annual Ezreal skin xD 
Teachers pet and all.

I think the problem is: All Ezreal actually is, is a basic human model that fires energy blasts.
That is such a plain canvas, you can paint almost any skin theme onto that an it'll work.

So every time riot think up a skin concept, they match it with different champs, and it fits Ezreal every time.

His personality is cocky and cool. So Pulsefire and Ace of spades themes work with him.
But he also has the community driven stigma of being kinda gay, so therefore skins like Star Guardian works for him too. 

And seeming Riot have a policy of _"it doesn't matter who gets skins, as long as the skin works for them."_ Its a lot easier for them to make a skin for Ezreal every time than it is to make ones for champions with  much more specific themes like Yorick and Illaoi.

At least I hope thats what it is.... 
I hope theres some logic to it and it's not just blatant favouritism...
I'm quite annoyed that Ezreal is a guy in the girl based skin line ;-;

Im just going to  start off by saying that I hate Ahri so much, of every champ in the game, she is probably the one I hate to fight most. 
She has poke coming out her ears, but also the ability to balls-to-the-wall hard engage out of nowhere as well.

I am disappointed that it's the same champions again and again that keep getting cool skins.
But I can see the reasoning behind this skin.

_________

It will sell, she's a much liked champion, her playrate is constant, unlike other currently popular champs. So while it isn't at a high of 15%, they know it wont drop drastically to 3% suddenly. That being said, I have no idea why there isn't 20+ Zed skins already, if I was Riot id be milking the living shit out of those adolescent wallets.

And she does fit the theme of star guardian.
The nine tailed fox did not originate in Japan it's true, due to Japan being a younger country than China/Korea, but it has firmly adopted the nine tailed fox and other fox spirits into both their culture and pop culture. Naruto is a clear example of this, and the Ghibli film Pom Poko shows this well too. 

But in any case, it doesn't actually matter whether she is anime or not, because the whole point of a skin is to change the theme of a champ, and if you wanted to go down that road, Ahri is hella more anime than Poppy or Lulu, or Jinx, or Sona, or MF.

The theme of the Star Guardians is 'Magical Girl' whose whole thing is 'Kawaii' etc etc.
So Ahri (being a cute champ) fits the theme much better than other champs like Miss Fortune or Soraka, who don't embody that 'cutsie' vibe. They are rather 'mature' and 'beautiful' or even too 'sexy' in Miss Fortunes case. So its my opinion that Ahri is a better star Guardian than MF or Raka. 

I can see why Riot picked her for Star Guardian, and _(as they constantly remind us, almost like they are trying to convince themselves more than us)_, they don't pick skins for champs based on who recently got skins, but on wether the skin fits a certain champion.

**However!**

Regardless of how well a skin fits a champion, there needs to be a time when you put your foot down and say 
_"We actually do need to make some skins for other champs now."_
Otherwise Ezreal and Ahri and co. will keep getting skins, and Yorick and Swain and Illaoi and co. will keep not getting skins, forever.

Yorick for example has never received a new skin.
Meanwhile Ezreal was created 7 years ago, and every single year except one since then, he has received a new skin like clockwork. _(many of which are average as)_

That shouldn't happen, it doesn't matter how well a skin fits someone, you cant just ignore champs for that long, while showering others.
Ezreal isn't even a great champ thematically, he's a blank canvas so of course every skin line In existence is going to work for him. All he is is just an average guy, you can paint him any colour you want and it wont conflict with his theme.

Ahri, Ezreal, Miss Fortune, and Soraka, I'm pretty sure have all received new skins for the last 3 or 4 years in a row. 
So while Star Guardian does fit them _(although it doesn't even work with MF at all)_ champions like Yorick, Swain, Illoai etc etc should not be ignored while these champs receive yet another skin.


________

Personally I don't buy the _"we only make skins for champs if the theme works for that champ"_, Simply because if after 7 years of trying, your creative team still hasn't thought up a single workable skin for Yorick.... it's time to fire them...

Yorick would fit very well into gothic/ metal /rock anything dark theme XD but if you've noticed lately, Rito has only been developing "cool" and "brightly coloured" skins of late. Probably why poor Yorick hasn't received any attention. Although I reckon the next set of "Star Guardian" skins should be for them... the "dark" themed ones x)
Star Guardian Urgot please!!! XD{{sticker:slayer-jinx-catface}}

I dont see why Bloodmoon Yorick isn't a thing tbh. He seems to fit all the criteria.
or something like Risen Yorick _(like the Fiddle skin)_ where he is some shuriman sand-walker.

Undersea Yorick would be cool too, with seaweed for his cape, and coral for his armour stuff, he could summon little sea creatures, and have a rock/coral wall.  Like a whole Davy Jones type thing.

and yes, Riot have embraced so many memes, it seems cruel to not have Star Guardian Urgot xD

>  Ahri is from Korean mythology

Ahri is a nine-tailed fox, which originated in Chinese mythology, but later became the Kitsune in Japanese mythology. So giving her a skin based on the magical girl theme from anime is a good design choice. 

Adding to the anime theme, Kitsune in human form (which Ahri is) are basically fox versions of Nekos (anime cat girls).

Let's not forget Arcade Ahri (the weebiest Ahri skin until Star Guardian). This was know as the "weeb" skin since it combined the anime arcade theme (I know there are arcades in the USA, but Japanese arcades are on a whole other level) with the Neko/Kitsune theme.

It's also why they made a Pop Star Ahri, because of it's connection to K/JPOP. Academy Ahri I can also sort of get because it takes themes from Japanese school girl sailor uniforms (another Japanese culture and anime trope). Challenger Ahri was something eSports related, so we can't say much about that?

I guess all of her skins make sense in some way, but honestly 7 skins (8 thanks to Star Guardian) is a bit too much considering quite a few champions only have 1 or 2. Then again Annie has 10... one of which is basically a few hundred dollars.

Honestly, I'm surprised she doesn't have a Maid skin yet, since that's another anime trope.

**TL;DR - Ahri is basically the "weeb" champion, based on Japanese (and partly Chinese) culture and mythology, so her having a Star Guardian skin was about time. But 8 skins is a bit OTT when others only have 1 or 2.**

> Ahri is basically the "weeb" champion

You make it sound like Yasuo isn't a thing. xD

He's like the staple swordsman character in every anime ever. 
Where my name comes form 'Lord Sesshomaru' is one such character :P
Even has the same shoulder armour, and a similar thing with his brother.

I didn't forget about the Japanese origin of Yasuo. It's just that this post was aimed at Ahri. Personally, Ahri is a lot more weeb than Yasuo, who I find more of a historical culture champion than a modern anime culture champion, if you get what I mean?

I know Lord Sesshomaru is a character (antagonist, I think?) from InuYasha. Is he the one with the white hair and the Sailor Moon symbol on his head?

Well I'm not going to argue, I hate both of them xD
Yea i get what you mean.

And yea, thats Sesshomaru, yea he's an antagonist in the same way that Magneto from X-men is an antagonist.

A thing to keep in mind is that the Skin Economy is the majority of what keeps this game afloat keeps this game. If they make skins for champions that have a low play rate like Atrox, They will only use money. The people who Design, animate, Implement, Voice act, Program dont work for free, so not only do they need to make money back on the wages, operation costs ect then turn a profit. While Riot is a game company and by all means of the imagination do a fantastic job of pleasing their patrons (Not the website the actual meaning) They are still a business, and like any business they are in the market to turn a profit. So why do champions like Ahri, Lux, annie So on so forth get skins more often? Its because its what sells, its what keeps the $$$$ rolling in and its what keeps everything both you and I love about the game afloat. By no means do I disagree with the whole ahri is over skinned. My Fav champion still only has 1 skin and even then Her base is better (Rip Taliyah Nerfs) but she isnt played and there for I will wait until either she is played enough or she gets the Kayle Treatment and they Throw her a pity skin.
riot probably has data which tells them that ahri skins sell better than most other champ skins = they'll keep on making ahri skins until this stops being true
